title: 113_hr3932
content: The Act titled "No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act of 2014" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and clarifies the application of this prohibition to premium credits and cost-sharing reductions under the Affordable Care Act. SEC. 101. PROHIBITING TAXPAYER FUNDED ABORTIONS. Title 1, United States Code is amended by adding a new chapter titled "PROHIBITING TAXPAYER FUNDED ABORTIONS." Sec. 301 prohibits federal funds from being used for abortions. Sec. 302 prohibits funding for health plans that cover abortion. Other sections address limitations on federal facilities, use of non-Federal funds for health coverage, and exceptions for abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. Sec. 302 prohibits the use of federal funds for health benefits plans that cover abortion. Sec. 303 limits abortion services in federal facilities and by federal employees. Sec. 304 clarifies that individuals, entities, or states can still purchase separate abortion coverage. Sec. 305 allows individuals, entities, or states to purchase abortion coverage using non-Federal funds without restrictions, as long as matching funds required for federally subsidized programs are not used. Sec. 306 states that the chapter does not affect other Federal laws regarding the use of funds for abortion or health benefits coverage. Sec. 307 clarifies that the chapter does not apply to treating complications from abortions, regardless of whether they were performed in accordance with Federal or State law. Abortion performed in accordance with Federal or State law, regardless of funding under section 308. Exceptions for abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. Application to District of Columbia. "In this chapter, any reference to funds appropriated by Federal law includes amounts within the District of Columbia budget approved by Act of Congress. The term 'Federal Government' also encompasses the government of the District of Columbia." SEC. 102. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF CHAPTERS. The table of chapters for title 1, United States Code, is amended by adding a new item: "4. Prohibiting taxpayer funded abortions - 301". TITLE II--APPLICATION UNDER THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT SEC. 201. CLARIFYING APPLICATION OF PROHIBITION TO PREMIUM CREDITS AND COST-SHARING REDUCTIONS UNDER ACA. The text discusses the disallowance of refundable credit and cost-sharing reductions for health plans that include coverage for abortions, with an option to purchase separate abortion coverage or plan. The text allows individuals to purchase separate abortion coverage or a health plan that includes abortion coverage, as long as no credit is provided for the premiums. Non-Federal health insurance issuers are also permitted to offer separate abortion coverage. The text prohibits health plans from offering coverage for abortions paid for with the tax credit. It also disallows the small employer health insurance expense credit for plans that include abortion coverage. The text prohibits qualified health plans from including coverage for abortions, except for specific circumstances outlined in the law. Employers are allowed to purchase separate coverage for abortions for their employees. The law allows employers to offer separate coverage for abortions in their health plans, as long as no credit is given for employer contributions towards that coverage. Non-Federal health insurance issuers are also permitted to offer separate coverage for abortions, as long as it is not paid for with any employer contribution eligible for the tax credit. The law allows separate coverage for abortions in health plans without employer contributions being eligible for tax credit. Amendments are made to ensure federal funds are not used for abortion coverage in multi-state qualified health plans offered in Exchanges. Amendments to the United States Code specify that changes apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2014, and plan years beginning after that date. SEC. 202. Revision of notice requirements for disclosure of health plan coverage of abortion and premium surcharges. The amendment to section 1303(b) of Public Law 111-148 requires disclosure of coverage for specific services by qualified health plans at the time of enrollment and in marketing materials. The amendment requires separate disclosure of abortion surcharges in qualified health plans that include such services, effective more than 30 days after the enactment of the Act.
